author: James R. Hagerty
title: FMC CEO Malott Thwarted Raiders by Loading Up Company With Debt
text:
In the mid-1980s, FMC Corp. was the type of cash-rich conglomerate that corporate raiders loved to buy, load up with debt and dismember. The companyâ€™s CEO, Robert Malott, beat them to the punch with his own plan.
The maker of agricultural chemicals, Bradley armored vehicles and oil-industry equipment paid a special dividend of $80 a share as part of a recapitalization that added about $2 billion of debt.
